text: William Benjamin Scandrett (7 February 1840 – 23 September 1917) was an English-born New Zealand politician. He immigrated to New Zealand in 1855 and came to Invercargill in 1862. He was the first town clerk of Invercargill after it was proclaimed a municipality, serving from 1871 to 1893. He was deputy mayor of Invercargill twice (1902 and 1911) and mayor of Invercargill three times (1894–1895, 1904–1909 and 1912–1913). Scandrett married Susannah Hinton Milstead and had five children. ==See also== *1894 Invercargill mayoral election *1912 Invercargill mayoral election ==References== ===Sources=== * * ==External links== * Southland and its Resources: Being a Paper on the Resources of the District of Southland, Otago, New Zealand ... title: William Benjamin Scandrett
